Build identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:10.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/10.0

Steps:

1. Open a new tab and trigger the web console 
2. Open a webpage 
3. Put the console in window mode 
4. Click on any console report on the content area (a warning, net event, etc) 

The web console moves on the screen after clicking anything

comments.raw_text:
Vlad: thanks for your report!


Not sure if the new component I picked is entirely correct. However, this is a general problem with xul:panels. They tend to move to the right and to the bottom a few pixels (usually the number of pixels is related to the height and width of the window decoration of the window manager). This happens after certain events, after dragging/opening/resizing a panel. The move happens when the user switches to do "something else" (eg. interact with other parts of the UI, via mouse or via keyboard).

This is probably a dupe of some other bug, but I don't remember which one.
